abstract: Members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making arm generally concurred that the central bank should eventually tighten monetary policy, but they disagreed on how to raise interest rates and reduce the balance sheet, according to minutes of last month’s meeting.
snippet: Members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making arm generally concurred that the central bank should eventually tighten monetary policy, but they disagreed on how to raise interest rates and reduce the balance sheet, according to minutes of last mo...
lead_paragraph: Members of the Federal Reserve’s policy-making arm generally concurred that the central bank should eventually tighten monetary policy, but they disagreed on how to raise interest rates and reduce the balance sheet, according to minutes of last month’s meeting, Sewell Chan and Javier C. Hernandez report in The New York Times.

headline.main: Fed Board Diverged on Timing of Policy Shift
